meanings.definition: A stalk supporting an inflorescence or single flower.
meanings.sent1: The peduncles of the sunflower held up the large, yellow bloom.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully trimmed the peduncles of the roses to encourage more blooms.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the peduncles as swings to play in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening was evident in how she tended to the peduncles with gentle care.
meanings.sent5: The peduncles swayed gently in the breeze, showcasing the beauty of nature.

meanings.definition: A stalk supporting a fruit or seed.
meanings.sent1: The apple tree's peduncles were heavy with ripe fruit.
meanings.sent2: She plucked the ripe strawberries by twisting the peduncles gently.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the peduncles as a ladder to reach the juicy fruits.
meanings.sent4: The peduncles of the cherry tree drooped under the weight of the sweet cherries.
meanings.sent5: The peduncles of the pumpkin plant grew stronger as the fruit ripened.

meanings.definition: A stalk supporting a brain structure.
meanings.sent1: The neuroscientist studied the peduncles of the brain to understand neural connections.
meanings.sent2: Injury to the peduncles can affect communication between different brain regions.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's brain had colorful peduncles that lit up when thinking.
meanings.sent4: The peduncles of knowledge intertwined in his brain, forming a web of understanding.
meanings.sent5: The peduncles of the brain resembled delicate bridges connecting thoughts and memories.
